page.title: 07RIVER RODING,BUCKHURST HILL
page.content: The River Roding is a riverthat flows through Essex from North to South,into the River Thames.We looked at two sections along the Roding.The first was a very flat area with a lot of rubbish in the river.The underground runs over the Roding on an arched bridge.There is a lake which used to be a quarry used in the building of the M11 Motorway.To the south is a sewage works.It is a tatty area with rubbish lying around. Section 2 is much nicer because it is cleaner and smater.The grass here is well looked after.Here there is another lake which was also used for the M11.On one side of the lake there is the remains of a barage blloon base from World War Two.This is now wasteland. This area is much used by locals for walking dos etc..
